metadata.title: CVE-2024-50293 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net/smc: do not leave a dangling sk pointer in __smc_create()Thanks to commit 4bbd360a5084 ("socket: Print pf->create() whenit does not clear sock->sk on failure."), syzbot found an issue withAF_SMC:smc_create must clear sock->sk on failure, family: 43, type: 1, protocol: 0 WARNING: CPU: 0 PID: 5827 at net/socket.c:1565 __sock_create+0x96f/0xa30net/socket.c:1563Modules linked in:CPU: 0 UID: 0 PID: 5827 Comm: syz-executor259 Not tainted6.12.0-rc6-next-20241106-syzkaller #0Hardware name: Google Google Compute Engine/Google Compute Engine, BIOSGoogle 09/13/2024 RIP: 0010:__sock_create+0x96f/0xa30 net/socket.c:1563Code: 03 00 74 08 4c 89 e7 e8 4f 3b 85 f8 49 8b 34 24 48 c7 c7 40 89 0c 8d8b 54 24 04 8b 4c 24 0c 44 8b 44 24 08 e8 32 78 db f7 90 <0f> 0b 90 90 e9d3 fd ff ff 89 e9 80 e1 07 fe c1 38 c1 0f 8c ee f7RSP: 0018:ffffc90003e4fda0 EFLAGS: 00010246RAX: 099c6f938c7f4700 RBX: 1ffffffff1a595fd RCX: ffff888034823c00RDX: 0000000000000000 RSI: 0000000000000000 RDI: 0000000000000000RBP: 00000000ffffffe9 R08: ffffffff81567052 R09: 1ffff920007c9f50R10: dffffc0000000000 R11: fffff520007c9f51 R12: ffffffff8d2cafe8R13: 1ffffffff1a595fe R14: ffffffff9a789c40 R15: ffff8880764298c0FS:  000055557b518380(0000) GS:ffff8880b8600000(0000)knlGS:0000000000000000CS:  0010 DS: 0000 ES: 0000 CR0: 0000000080050033CR2: 00007fa62ff43225 CR3: 0000000031628000 CR4: 00000000003526f0DR0: 0000000000000000 DR1: 0000000000000000 DR2: 0000000000000000DR3: 0000000000000000 DR6: 00000000fffe0ff0 DR7: 0000000000000400Call Trace: <TASK>  sock_create net/socket.c:1616 [inline]  __sys_socket_create net/socket.c:1653 [inline]  __sys_socket+0x150/0x3c0 net/socket.c:1700  __do_sys_socket net/socket.c:1714 [inline]  __se_sys_socket net/socket.c:1712 [inline]For reference, see commit 2d859aff775d ("Merge branch'do-not-leave-dangling-sk-pointers-in-pf-create-functions'")

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-50293` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-39-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1

linux-image-4.8.0-39-lowlatency - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.8.0-39-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1004-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
